metadata.title: CVE-2017-5613 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Format string vulnerability in cgiemail and cgiecho allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in a template file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5613` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgiemail - 1.6-37+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cgiemail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6-37+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
